reg_pit.title: Extraprovincial Companies and Foreign Entities from a Designated Province Regulation

change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 141/2012, effective July 1, 2012.

section.sectiontext: For the purposes of Division 4 of Part 11 of the Act and this regulation, Alberta is a designated province.

change.changenote: Section 2 (c) was added by BC Reg 268/2019, effective January 1, 2020.
Section 3.2 was enacted by BC Reg 205/2012, effective November 1, 2012.
Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 141/2012, effective July 1, 2012.

section.marginalnote: How registrar may transmit records, etc.

subsection.subsectiontext: The registrar may collect records, filings, applications, information, forms, notices and fees from a company for an extraprovincial registrar and transmit them to the extraprovincial registrar in one or more of the following manners, as applicable:

Without limiting subsection (1), the registrar may collect a name search fee in the amount of $30 for a name search required by the extraprovincial registrar and transmit the fee to the service provider.
In subsection (2), service provider means the service provider designated by the registrar to perform a name search required by the extraprovincial registrar.
